## **Database Connection**

First I loaded the `DBI`, `RPostgres`, and `dplyr` packages which will allow me to connect to the database and query it.

```{r warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(DBI)
library(RPostgres)
library(dplyr)
```

Next I will set the parameters to connect to my local database.

```{r}
# establish connection with postgres data base
con <- dbConnect(RPostgres::Postgres(),dbname = 'postgres',
      host = 'localhost',
      port = 5432,
      user = 'postgres',
      password = 'vannah') 

```

Once connected I can construct a query.

```{r}
res <- dbSendQuery(con, "
                   SELECT *
                   FROM pogodata
                   LIMIT 100;")

```

And the execute the query.

```{r}
# execute query
q_df <- dbFetch(res)
```

After I am done with using the database I will clear out the query and disconnect from the database in order so save resources.

```{r}
# clear query
dbClearResult(res)

# disconnect from database
dbDisconnect(con)
```
